title: >>> GODSMACKed
body_text:
To become a "legend", one must possess talents like pinpoint accuracy, the ability to stop a missile, and an overall passion and love for the game itself.
To become a "God", one must celebrate their birthday ...
LENNY HERRERA & MIKE "SPUTZ" KROTT REIGN SURPEME!
"Catching Machine" Award winners, long-time legends, call them what you will, DODGEBALL 85 belonged to these two beloved competitors. The third birthday extravaganza was "twice" the fun as the previous gatherings.
The bday tradition continued as icons Lenny Herrera and Mike "Sputz" ruled with an iron fist at DODGEBALL 85. Unlike the previous birthday bashes, the catching icons took a more selfish approach to the game.
GOD Mode
: Lenny and "Sputz" were immune from elimination. They were allowed however to eliminate enemies at any time. Only a "God" could eliminate a "God".
MORTAL Mode
: When 4 teammates remained for either Lenny and/or "Sputz",
GOD Mode
vanished. They could be hit or have a ball caught by any opponent at any time.
DEATH
: Once a team was left with 3 players (discluding Lenny and "Sputz"), the "Gods" were relieved of their duties whether they were eliminated or not.
A unique set-up? You bet.
>> Kevin Megill vs. Diana DiBuccio
"I think that last night continued to go with the recent theme of the teams being extremely even. And that has made for some exciting matches and games. Hopefully that streak continues."
- RAY MARZARELLA
Dodging extraordinaire Ray Marzarella hit the nail right on the head. One of the closest and certainly electrifying matches in recent memory. Handpicked by Lenny and "Sputz", Season 1 icons Kevin Megill and Diana DiBuccio squared off in a never-before-seen encounter.
In the end, it was powerhouse Megill narrowly defeating the female titan by a score of 3 to 2.
Megill won Games 1, 4, and 5 while Diana took Games 2 and 3. The lights went off while Game 6 was in progress, so it is unknown what would have happened had DODGEBALL 85 continued. Regardless, the powerful Kevin Megill earned a record-setting fourth win as captain.
Moments & Stars
: Alison Bertsch's twisting-catch; the posterboard birthday cards for "Sputz" and Lenny; young new blood Robert Pellecchia's overall longevity
"'God' mode was very interesting to say the least. [It] added a different sort of dimension of the games; more strategic."
- RAY MARZARELLA
"Mike Krott and Lenny's special 'God' mode rules, coupled with the intermittent rain and Human rim catchers made this a uniquely interesting event. It's great how different elements can be added to keep the games fresh, and the players on their toes."
- MIKE BUTLER
BIRTHDAY RECORDS
> Attendance: 25
> Biggest Return: Travis Mills (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 41)
> New Players: (1) Robert Pellecchia
- Because of the first-ever double birthday celebration, Lenny Herrera and Mike "Sputz" Krott called all the shots at DODGEBALL 85:
I.
Captains were Kevin Megill and Diana DiBuccio.
II.
Lenny and "Sputz" played in
God Mode
; a first for the sport.
III.
Matches were played under standard rules, with inclusion of Human Rims. Painballs were completely eliminated by Game 2.
IV.
After teams were formed, Lenny joined Team DIBUCCIO while "Sputz" sided with Team MEGILL.
- DODGEBALL 85 was played on the Back Courts of Wall High School for the second consecutive week.
- Kevin Megill defeated Diana DiBuccio, improving his overall record to 4-1-0. Megill became only the 4th player in history to capture his 4th captains victory (along with Joe Kelly, Kevin Adams, and Chris Adams). As for Diana, this loss puts her at 2-3-2.
- Kristen Driscoll, Joe Rispoli, and Joey Smalls also returned to action after several weeks of inactivity.
- DODGEBALL 85 was held on the one year anniversary of DODGEBALL XXX-SEVEN.
- And credit to the title of this entry, "GODSMACKed", goes to legend Chris Adams.
"80s" Comparison
- DODGEBALL 80, DODGEBALL 82, and DODGEBALL 84 each had an attendance of 24.
- DODGEBALL 80, DODGEBALL LXXXI, and DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE were all
Wet Wars
. DODGEBALL 85 has been added to list at the 18th
Wet War
.
________________________________________
___________________
2005 vs. 2007
CREAMations
,
Rimshot Contests
, a PondScum showdown, and a double birthday gathering have easily created countless memories in the first half of Season 9. And we're far from over.
On
May 5
, DODGEBALL 86 officially kicks off
The Road to 90
with an epic encounter between arguably, the two greatest teenagers to ever set foot on the dodgeball courts. Season 1 veteran and icon, 17 year-old
Kevin Adams
, will meet his match in perhaps the hottest young star in the 2007 year, all-around superstar
Grant Cornero
. This one will be talked about for a long time to come.
*DODGEBALL 87 (May 12): Sisters meet one on one ...
Liz Nogueira vs. Kathryn Nogueira
*DODGEBALL 88 (May 19): Undefeated dodging legends collide ...
Mike Edwards vs. Mike Butler
*DODGEBALL 89 (May 26): Announcement Coming Soon!
*DODGEBALL 90 (June 2): Announcement Coming Soon!

GOD Mode: Lenny and "Sputz" were immune from elimination. They were allowed however to eliminate enemies at any time. Only a "God" could eliminate a "God".

Megill won Games 1, 4, and 5 while Diana took Games 2 and 3. The lights went off while Game 6 was in progress, so it is unknown what would have happened had DODGEBALL 85 continued. Regardless, the powerful Kevin Megill earned a record-setting fourth win as captain.

> Attendance: 25

- Because of the first-ever double birthday celebration, Lenny Herrera and Mike "Sputz" Krott called all the shots at DODGEBALL 85:

IV. After teams were formed, Lenny joined Team DIBUCCIO while "Sputz" sided with Team MEGILL.

- DODGEBALL 85 was played on the Back Courts of Wall High School for the second consecutive week.
- Kevin Megill defeated Diana DiBuccio, improving his overall record to 4-1-0. Megill became only the 4th player in history to capture his 4th captains victory (along with Joe Kelly, Kevin Adams, and Chris Adams). As for Diana, this loss puts her at 2-3-2.

- And credit to the title of this entry, "GODSMACKed", goes to legend Chris Adams.

- DODGEBALL 80, DODGEBALL 82, and DODGEBALL 84 each had an attendance of 24.
- DODGEBALL 80, DODGEBALL LXXXI, and DODGEBALL EIGHTY-THREE were all Wet Wars. DODGEBALL 85 has been added to list at the 18th Wet War.
___________________________________________________________

2005 vs. 2007
CREAMations, Rimshot Contests, a PondScum showdown, and a double birthday gathering have easily created countless memories in the first half of Season 9. And we're far from over.

On May 5, DODGEBALL 86 officially kicks off The Road to 90 with an epic encounter between arguably, the two greatest teenagers to ever set foot on the dodgeball courts. Season 1 veteran and icon, 17 year-old Kevin Adams, will meet his match in perhaps the hottest young star in the 2007 year, all-around superstar Grant Cornero. This one will be talked about for a long time to come.

*DODGEBALL 87 (May 12): Sisters meet one on one ... Liz Nogueira vs. Kathryn Nogueira
*DODGEBALL 88 (May 19): Undefeated dodging legends collide ... Mike Edwards vs. Mike Butler
*DODGEBALL 89 (May 26): Announcement Coming Soon!
*DODGEBALL 90 (June 2): Announcement Coming Soon!
